root.name: arc()
root.description: Draws an arc in the display window. Arcs are drawn along the outer edge of an ellipse defined by the x, y, width and height parameters. The origin or the arc's ellipse may be changed with the ellipseMode() function. The start and stop parameters specify the angles at which to draw the arc. These angles are specified in terms of radians by default, but by degrees if angleMode(DEGREES) has been called.
root.syntax: ellipse(x, y, width, height, start, stop)

parameter.label: x
parameter.description: int or float: x-coordinate of the arc's ellipse

parameter.label: y
parameter.description: int or float: y-coordinate of the arc's ellipse

parameter.label: width
parameter.description: int or float: width of the arc's ellipse

parameter.label: height
parameter.description: int or float: height of the arc's ellipse

parameter.label: start
parameter.description: int or float: angle to start the arc, specified in radians or degrees depending on the current angle mode

parameter.label: stop
parameter.description: int or float: angle to stop the arc, specified in radians or degrees depending on the current angle mode
